pkgmetadata.longdescription: Soil and Chemical Substance Emission and Transport Model // An enhanced version of the semi-empirical, spatially distributed emission and transport model PhosFate implemented in 'R' and 'C++'. It is based on the D-infinity, but also supports the D8 flow method. The currently available substances are suspended solids (SS) and particulate phosphorus (PP). A major feature is the allocation of substance loads entering surface waters to their sources of origin, which is a basic requirement for the identification of critical source areas and in consequence a cost-effective implementation of mitigation measures. References: Hepp et al. (2022) doi:10.1016/j.jenvman.2022.114514; Hepp and Zessner (2019) doi:10.3390/w11102161; Kovacs (2013) http://hdl.handle.net/20.500.12708/9468.
